So I can close out this chapter and start anew.

Well. Blah, I am so discontent right now.

http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/48644.html

Pretty much. Life is nice, I enjoy it all.
The bad is good, because that is how we learn.
I suppose.

I went to this show last night, with a half stranger, and a complete stranger.
I was kind of scared actually.
But it was so good.
Being with people who knew nothing about me.
The night was amazing. Even the part of me being killed by courage crew.
But whatever.
BLah.


Hmmm. I am in love, with life.
For this second in time.
I might take these words back.
Sometime. But not now.

I'm rambling.
Goodbye.
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/48393.html

I'm not here to get in your way.
I want to please you.
And everyone else.
So please when you are done. Toss me aside.
It is all I am good for.
When you need me let me know, and I will put you on the calendar.
But other than that, I don't think I can be a service to you.
And I don't want to be.
I just want to be your friend.
And I want a friend in return.
Not a therapist, doctor, or whatever.
Just a person on the other end of the phone, not speaking, but filling the silence with the thoughts in their head.

Oh goodness she is loosing her touch.
Loosing sight of reality.

<big>I don't even want words.
Just a hug to get lost in.
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/48219.html

Pretty much.
This is it.
I'm tired.
I can't please people.
I have worn out my welcome.
Some people can't stand me.
I can't stand them.
But I don't mind.
We all get by, and if this is it, then so be it.
I love everybody, none the less.
I still love this life none the less.
I still love each day that I am so great-fully blessed with.
So stop complaining.
bye.


The rain makes everything that much better.
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/48016.html

I wish i could explain the way I feel, but it's impossible.
I want to rewind time, and remember your eyes.
I wish I paid more attention to your words, because now when I think back, they are all distorted.
one down.
and now I keep thinking towards the future,
and I have no direction.
shut up.
two down.
I have been fine with the whole I have nobody at my side situation. Until now.
And my thoughts wont stop racing.


Safely in my stomach rests my enemy.
The diphenhydramine should be kicking in soon.
So close the eyes, and erase the world.
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/47763.html

[Don't get mad.
But if I didn't continuously take these pills
I wouldn't be happy.]



My eyes are sunken in and sealed shut.
Where to go from here.
My heart is empty.
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/47376.html

I didn't want to come home, and now I know why.

The moon was held in the same sky, I was just in a new area looking up at it.
But it looked so much better there, here, the moon disappoints me for it no longer holds any truth.

I want to cry. I can feel the tears eroding my thoughts.


I just want to be left alone, locked in my room. I can't handle this world I live.


I remember I didn't want to go to D.C. and this morning I found myself in shambles because I had to leave.


[Changes affect me all to well, and now I am in MISERY.]
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/47326.html

...and my life restarts. Back to reality...
and I hate it, a lot.
You ripped me from a land I grew onto, a place I never intended on leaving.
My heart was left in the hotel room.
And so was my shampoo.
Washington, D.C. was my life made perfect, it opened my eyes, and inspired me like I have never felt before.
But it was like a motivational push.

But now I'm stuck.
The plane took away my corpse, but left behind my soul.

I laughed for a whole week straight, I fell in love, learned to speak up, I found matches made in heaven.
and now it's gone.

My roommates were from St. Crouix which is in the VIrgin Islands, and they were the coolest people ever.

Some highlights of this week include:
+Meeting people...
.Josh
.Matt
.Ariel
.Nalissa
.Ellery
.Eric
-plus 294239047 more amazing kids.
+Being chased slash almost killed by bums.
+Falling in love a little.
+Alaskans say NOOOOOOO.


all in all.
oh dang.
please take me back.
that's my home.
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/46890.html

I wish I had something to say,
but I don't. Looks say enough.
And if you were to be looking into my eyes right now, they would be saying I love you. so much.

I will miss everybody terribly.


I'm hyped, I'm awkward feeling. I'm lost.
Maybe I am just looking for my body's remains.


I leaving behind all of this packed away in a box until I return.
[And I'm not looking forward to reopening these drama filled situations when I return.]


I CAN'T BELIEVE I'M LEAVING.


See you saturday.
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/46631.html

I was so excited to see you.
But when I looked in your eyes, I was shocked. Who was this person standing in front of me.
It was hard to take it all in so fast.
I'm still in shock, I felt like I was staring down the nose of a stranger, for I have never seen you before.

Something had changed.


Welcome home brother, nice to meet you [again].

I cried for a girl I have never seen in my life today, just because she din't deserve her fate.
And each day, people like her are killed, just for the sake of someone's sick sick mind.

I wish it was summer, I wish I was numb.
Everything I am feeling is so real, and I am not sure I know how to handle it.


Gosh. Take it all away. Inside I am twisting and turning, and every smile I crack makes it hurt worse...
because I know it's not real.



I'm sorry.

http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/45748.html

A drought within her tear ducts, too many hours of sorrowful crying.
Hours of repression, she was a prisoner of a mind she wished not to call her own.
On the floor of a dimly lit bedroom, a razor blade drops so gently, 
As her body grows limp her thoughts grow wild.
A sacrifice to those who have ever wanted out, a debt she bestowed.
16 an age of naivety, 21 an age naivety, 56 an age of naivety.
This was to all the ones who knew better, who knew the harder path was better.
But one slit too many and a child has died, 45, 31, their age undefined;
But they did it for you, the ones who have thought about it, but [thankfully] have never completed the task.

[And another day in a world of despair.]

[They never found the cause, but I am the effect.]




[What if I never see your face again?
What will I do?]


BlurbsBlobsBlah.
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/45192.html

Last night I made my stomach twist and turn into several knots among knots, from the fear of returning to school.
I entered the doors this morning however with no action of hesitation. I became rather excited to be in the place I have, by nature proclaimed to be my hole of hell.
I decided I always have had values on education, but I never put them to work, and I actually want to learn things.
So I will.

Today is gorgeous, the air leaves me comforted, because I know everything is okay, and will stay that way until i beg to differ.


[Let's hold hand and skip to the loo, my darling.]
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/44966.html

My heart has sunken down into an unknown abyss.
I am not in a state of mind to be returning to school, I am too used to the freedom that was bestowed upon us all. 
Spring however was a splendid intro to what summer can/should be.
Over this week I have realized what people mean most to me and the ones who are just to ut to get, for their own sake.

Downtown last night was nice, we met Thomas. A german heart throb, but one I wish to learn from. It's weird, because  I can not stop replaying our short talk underneath the pavilion. Yeah, he may be dreamy, but to me there is something beyond that, I want to walk in his shoes.... or shall I say his boots.

I will be gone in a week. I kind of don't want to go. I feel so sick thinking about the week I have to get through in order to leave this place.



[This girl needs therapy.]
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/44620.html

My fingers are electric, they wish to type on and on, with no purpose or specific destination, just in hopes of relieving themselves of their guilt driven conscience.
Every word gives my life less and less value; but it's okay, I can't give up now.
I made a promise, one that I wish to never break. But when the world does not stop something is bound to cease in it's tracks.
When you find it in your heart to tell me how you feel, I will find it in my heart to let you in.
But keep knocking on my door, because I am in need of a friendly face.


I pray each night for you, I hope you will find me, where ever you may be.


This is the cure. A keyboard and a blank page to type it all out. This is the cure, this is what will save you when you break down your world in to minuscule pieces. Thoughts everyday keep your mind away, and that's that.
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/44454.html

Odds are you really do not know me, or understand the thoughts that constantly flow through each and every membrane of my body.
If in your lifetime you ever come across a person you do not understand, chances are you will want to know this person, you just don't know it. The people who can display themselves on their sleeves are a waste of time, because you can see what they stand for; it is the people who walk around in plain colors who have more meaning then a rainbow.


Content is what I am. Discontent is how I am acting.
I feel the feeling that you warned me of.



Help me, for I am my worst enemy.
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/43903.html

Frankenmuth, a town that's economic boom has come from it's sales in fudge, and other sweet treats that make all the little old ladies ooo and awe.
I felt so foreign and out of pace, the clicks of all the hooves made me mad. I wasn't up for a slow motion type of deal, I was ready to run a race that nobody would let me achieve. 
I didn't want to sit and talk or give my grandmother a bath, I wanted to sleep away the days and think.
Spending most of this little trip sleeping in the car as I awaited my family members to return from which ever 3243948 store they were in.
I felt like I didn't leave Brighton because my mind was there, along side my heart and hamstrings.

I inhaled and exhaled in a world that focused on the slow pace of living; but all I was doing wa spitting my lung polltution of a world that was once pure.
Oh so contaminating.

As for my mother... she needs something I can not give.
I love her, just sometimes hearts get broken.


So let's rewind a little, we all have gone astray.
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/43640.html

Nobody can crush me like you can.
Nobody can make me feel worse than you make me feel.
Everyday ends in a constant stream of tears trailing down my face, because in your eyes everything is my fault.
I can't be there for you, because I won't listen to your endless list of complaints.
The sound of your voice makes me so sick to my stomach sometimes.
I hate everything about you, but I have to love you.
The only reason you care about me is because you have to.
You have tied my noose, and now with your words you make me want to jump, so it would be my fault, not yours.

My mom is really good at making me feel like nothing.

Throw more stuff, bitch a little louder, and maybe I will jump.
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/43480.html

Maybe I'm a jerk, or maybe I am the only one living in reality, whoops there goes gravity.
I'm not content standing in one place for too long, so do forgive me.
I'm pretty into the whole live your life not waste it, state of mind.
So when you ask me to sew my head to the carpet and glue my eyes to a spot on the wall, don't be upset if I turn you down, that's just not my idea of fun.

Maybe taking a break (and going to Frankenmuth is what I need) so I can get away from people and people can get away form me.

However, I love everybody that is in my life so dearly, so when i come back let's go for a walk and ramble on about this life and it's everlasting lists of possibilities.


love you.
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/43051.html

Whoever said staying in one place is a good thing, was a complete idiot.

Get me on the next train, you'll see me at the next show.
In a crowd of nameless faces, where each face I will soon know so well, I will know their posture and poise, I will see the way they carry on. So let's talk, I want to know you.

Drummer hit me a beat, my heart has no where else to go.

Give me a boy. Shy, in the most outrageous of ways. Wrong in all the right places. One willing to go on adventures just for the sake of going.

My life no longer has a form, it's a day to day type of thing from here on out.
Because my heart is in the right place.


On this Easter day, my life is turned upside down [just how I like it]. Oh God [thank you for everything]. Church was inspiring, and makes me want to live.
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/42988.html

I have this down, I can't slip now.
My mouth is moving too fast, I'm saying things I don't mean.
Oh, I crave those nights [summer nights], sprawled across the grass dreaming. The stars perfectly aligned, and we have no worries.
[stop wishing, start living.]
The sooner we get through these days, the sooner new days will come.

I've realized maybe I've changed a lot, too much? No. Yes. Maybe.
I don't know, I'm not unhappy, I am just restless with certain faces.
I'm restless here, and I want to move on. 

I want to do amazing things before my youth is taken from my grips.
So let's get a move on.
[I barley know you, but why does that matter? We are both in this game together. So let's hold hands, I wont mind.]
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/42536.html

Everyday the same huge tree, the same girl under it.
The only thing changing is the book in her hands and the people who cassually pass her by.
An apple core sits at her feet everyday, she too is a firm believer in 'an apple a day keeps the doctor away.'
The autumn leaves breeze pass her face and strands of hair cover her eyes.
Now zoom out.
A college campus, in the fall, students hustling and bustling everywhere.
But her world is at a stand still, her physical being is motionless except the occasional blink of her eyes; it is when you look inside her mind when you realize she is climbing a mountain, scuba diving in the sea, or taking on any other role her book may ask her to perform.
You as an onlooker would think she's an english major taking a break from her classes, but no.
She's a jealous onlooker of those college students who pass her by each day.
An unsuccessful high school career left her here, left her at the exit door.
But this is her entrance to her world.

Under this tree a story of hoplessness turned into a trial of fate.
The people each day came and went, upset, happy, or lost.
But she sat there, knowing what she felt, knowing where she was, and knowing who she was.
She didn't have any degree, and barely a high school diploma for the matter.
But she had the life she dreamed of.

Things do not have meaning until we define them.
Meaningful is meaningless.
Go figure.



....

But I realized today, everybody's negativity and low disposition, has left me taking a number in line next to them.
Moods to me are just as contagious as germs.

give me some time.
Because a revolution has occured within me and it's not over until the soldiers go marching home.


[optimism.]
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/41990.html

Get a grip, grab a seat, and ladies and gentlemen I welcome you to this mess of a life.
[my life.]
Truly, I was feeling what I felt, I wrote words, that at the time I clung to so helplessly.
I forgot what it was to have a voice, and I forgot I don't have to deal with your crap.
People are people. They are dumb, relentless, and they are what causes us to go home with a tampered head and  a broken heart.
I can't believe I took it, and dealt with it. Why settle with what you received, why not make things a little more interesting.
Yes, school sucks, and I'm doing horrible in most of my classes, but all the more reason to prove myself wrong.
Yes, people have been on my every nerve (good and bad) but people come and go, and your family is always there, so sooner or later you will have to learn to live with it. Communication is a keen skill.

As for today I am stable.
And as for today I am content.
http://dropa-heart.livejournal.com/41875.html

I wish I had these words down. I can't recall what I was thinking.
I've been missing out on sleep, due to my constant thought process.
I wish I could share these words with you. Truly I do.
I am feeling such amazement, at the worst time.
I realized last night that the ability to feel so awful is a gift that I will gladly except, only because sometimes we need something to remind us we're still human. 
I also realized, maybe I'm not the person I thought I was, I always thought I was a good person until I noticed I wasn't.
This slow music makes my head so unstable.
But the same four tracks have been on repeat for days, and please don't change the station, because I'm not ready to move on, I'm not ready to let go.

Note to self: You can get through this.


I remember my never dying optimism, where did it go?
Well, while I'm working hard to regain my self esteem, confidence, and ability to cope, I will just stay solitary in my head.

Crash. It just hit. Damn it. Reality strikes again. Oh my gosh.
What am I doing? Seriously what the heck.
I thought I could do this....
but really.

I can't.



The cursor is blinking, waiting for me to move along.
but since I can't I'll just stop here.

Corrupt. Loud. Polluted. Overpopulated. These words describe a place my eyes once saw. These words describe a place I'm already craving to return to. These words describe all I want. A world where you are one in a million.


Buildings tower over your small being, you amount to nothing more than a grain of sand, but the city has never felt so much like home. The paths I walked, I hope to walk everyday, in the future.
Insecurity is so securing. I never have felt so lost, so dazed, and so unprotected; but never have I felt like I was where I was meant to be.

This is how I see the future.
A crowded newsroom, filled with writers of all sorts, running and rushing to make their deadline. Everyone is frantic, everyone is crazed; the newsroom walls are filled with windows, and the 15th floor has an amazing view of the chicago skyline, it's the only reassurance the reporters have. I leave the Chicago Tribune at a late hour, just despite time. i take the subway longer than necessary, just to sort my thoughts. You fly by people awaiting in the cold, awaiting for their turn to get their thoughts in line. I get off, and walk the chilly walk all alone, the streets are dark, and filled with am erie hue. I make it to my small, dirty apartment, to sit and write. And that's all I want.

Call me silly, because I daydream a lot.

No matter how hard we try to conform, or even fight conformity.
We are such different people (than i think we realize).
I don't know what people see when they look at me, and I don't know what anyone really thinks of me.
People can take my face, and put it in a crowd of other adolescent kids who are lost.
But the one thing that will make me different from the rest is that i know deep down I have something they don't. And hopefully it will shine through.
So on the topic of who I am, let me have a moment to introduce myself.
We maybe friends.. but you might not know me...

I'm Laura. Ordinary. Autumn is my favorite, it reminds me of my childhood. It makes me think of the possibility this life has. The soundtrack to my life would be 104.3 (the oldies channel). I dance in the kitchen with my mom, and it's my favorite thing to do. Saturday mornings are the best, I like waking up to children playing outside, and birds chirping. I miss sitting alone in my room on fridays nights, wondering what the world was doing. I try to be care-free, but really I'm a really anxious person. I have no confidence what so ever, nor do I have self-esteem. When I was young I used to lie about everything, because I thought my life was boring. I wanted to be a bus driver when I was 6. I've always liked playing with boys, in a recces type of way(and i still so). I think the most heartbreaking moment of my life was seeing my dad getting arrested. My mother has endured so much in her life I don't know how she continues to smile, she is my strength. I like going to churches, when there's nobody there, and lying down just to feel like I'm one with God, whom I love. I like going to shows, because it's so chaotic much like life, and everyone is in it together. I have three brothers, and I can't imagine life without them. I have one surviving grandparent, and she's one of my best friends, she is truly amazing. My aunt debbie is my mom number 2, she gets me in a way, that only an aunt can understand. I wish I could save the world. My past relationships have been nothing but heart shredding and meaningless. Night life is my favorite, I like the hustle and bustle of the city and the serenity of the country. I'm a nature type of gal. And that's all for now.

If you read that all;
thanks, it was nice (re)meeting you.

I have taken a moment of reflection, I have gazed upon my most recent entries and I have reached the conclusion that, you may get the idea that I'm unhappy.
Don't let me fool you.
I'm fine, maybe I'm just searching for something to be wrong.

A desperate girl, and I know my head is trying to out speak my heart.
